title: Business Live: Friday 20 September - BBC News
summary: deutsche bank shares climb on lower fine hopes .
cryan says 'hefty speculation ' behind share price fall .
bt warns that rates could push up bills .

documents.title: goodnight
text: that 's all from from the business live page for today .
join us again at 6am on monday .

documents.title: pilots union upbeat on monarch deal
text: the british airline pilots ' association ( balpa ) has welcomed the civil aviation authority 's decision to temporarily extend monarch airlines ' atol licence .
brian strutton , general secretary of balpa , said : `` the uncertainty hanging over monarch has been lifted which will be good news for the pilots , crew , staff and customers .

`` although the monarch licence has been extended temporarily for 12 days , my understanding is this will be sufficient to satisfy the regulator that long term funding is secure and details of this will emerge over the next few days . ''

documents.title: us shares rally on possible deutsche deal
text: us stocks ended the day 171 points ahead after fears over deutsche bank receded .
the dow jones industrial average closed nearly 1 % higher at 18,314 .
there was speculation on friday that deutsche bank had negotiated a substantial cut to a $ 14bn fine handed down by us department of justice .
the bank was fined for mis-selling mortgage-backed securities during the financial crisis .
deutsche bank 's ability to pay the fine had caused considerable concern .
however , deutsche bank 's stock closed 13.7 % higher .
nasdaq ended 55 points ahead at 5,324 .

documents.title: caa urges flyers to always seek atol
text: the civil aviation authority ( caa ) also issued additional advice as it confirmed a deal to extend its air travel organisers ' licensing ( atol ) scheme for monarch airlines .
the scheme refunds customers if a travel firm collapses , and ensures they are not stranded .
without it , monarch airlines can not sell package holidays .

it said : `` the caa always advises consumers to ensure they book atol-protected air holidays and consumers who choose to book an atol-protected flight or holiday with the company during this time will continue to be protected by the atol scheme .
`` during this period of extension , the caa will continue to monitor the company . ''

documents.title: big relief at monarch deal
text: it may only be temporary but there is much relief that monarch has had the licence that allows it to sell package holidays extended .
and breathe # monarchairlines # greatnews
monarch pulls through so pleased not only for me but the thousand of staff # monarchairlines # relief

documents.title: caa confirms monarch agreement
text: the bbc 's john moylan tweets :
@ uk caa says `` monarch now has 12 days to satisfy the caa that the group is able to meet the requirements for a full atol licence '' .
@ monarch
@ twitterid confirms granted @ twitterid a 12 day atol license extension which will expire at 23:59 on 12 october 2016 .

documents.title: monarch owners put up capital for extension
text: the bbc understands that greybull capital , the investment company which owns monarch airlines , has put in some additional money which has given the civil aviation authority the confidence to extend the company 's atol licence .
until 12 october .
by that time monarch airlines has confidence that it can secure additional investment - the biggest in its 48 year history .
it is believed that some of the money will be used to proceed with an order for 30 boeing aircraft .
there are more than 100,000 monarch holiday makers overseas at the moment .

documents.title: monarch wins two-week extension
text: monarch airlines has been handed only a short extension to its atol licence .
confirmation - @ twitterid has been granted temporary extension of # atol license by @ twitterid until oct 12th .
see @ twitterid for latest
journalists should study how to spell licence or invest in an english spell checker .
fair point stewart .
must have got it wrong 20 times yesterday .
j

documents.title: monarch receives 'significant ' investment
text: monarch airlines has also announced it had `` received significant further investment from shareholders and is close to announcing the largest investment in its 48-year history '' .
monarch had been dogged by speculation that it was struggling in the face of terrorist incidents putting off tourists , the falling value of the pound and brexit .

documents.title: breakingcaa grants monarch a stay on atol licence
text: monarch airlines has won an extension to its atol licence which will allow the budget airline to keep selling package holidays .
monarch is part of the government-backed atol scheme , which compensates travelers in full and ensures they are not stranded if a holiday company collapses .
if the civil aviation authority ( caa ) had not extended the licence , monarch would have been unable to sell package holidays .

andrew swaffield , chief executive of the monarch group , said : `` i am delighted that we have been able to come to an agreement with the caa on the extension of monarch 's atol licence and am excited about the additional capital coming into the group which will help us fund our future growth .
`` i am immensely proud of the professionalism of the monarch team . ''

documents.title: breakingmonarch temporary licence extended
text: understands # monarch has been granted a temporary extension of its atol license by the caa
@ twitterid said there was nothing to worry about , apparently

documents.title: fast return for slowhand
text: a good place to invest is in art and if you have a few million to spare you can make a big return - just like eric clapton .
the legendary guitarist , who is nicknamed slowhand , is set to sell abstraktes bild 809-2 , a painting by german artist gerhard richter .
mr clapton originally paid $ 3.4m for the painting which is now expected to fetch $ 20m when it is auctioned at christie 's in november .
according to bloomberg he sold two other pieces by the artist in 2012 and 2013 , for a combined $ 55.2 million .

documents.title: us energy industry adds more rigs
text: america 's oil industry is slowly gathering pace .
new figures show that the number of rigs exploring for oil and natural gas in the us rose by 11 this week to 522 .
however , according to baker hughes , the oilfield services company , that compares to 809 active rigs a year ago .
brent crude prices slipped back slightly to $ 49.15 a barrel but us oil rose to $ 48.08 .

documents.title: shut up !
text: it is an age-old myth that the people who commute on london underground are miserable and grumpy .
turns out , that myth is true and there is now a campaign group who wants chatty tube travelers to keep it buttoned .
campaign group launches @ twitterid campaign
@ twitterid they need to hand this out at every tube station in london asap
miserable lot !
what a bunch of misery guts
people do n't even make eye contact or smile never mind a chat .
its sad we now rely on apps for social interactions .
no one but foreigners attempt talk unless nose to armpit on packed train .
the odd snark is allowed .
ooh i know what a snark is
urban dictionary : combination of snide & remark .
sarcastic .
my use of snark was wrong .
packed train , we just grin & bear it .
i would absolutely go out of my way to talk to these sad people .
more likely to have me talking to them by wearing that .
perfect for winding people up .
southerners
excellent ! !
a pint of sulphuric acid usually does the trick ! ! !

a depression of commuters .

insular ingrates.let them walk

they all seem as though they 'll crap themselves if they utter a word .

documents.title: bmw dreams of electric cars
text: bmw is to offer all electric versions of its next generation bmw x3 compact sport utility vehicle and electric mini models so drivers can be flashy and environmentally aware .
people will able to get their hands on an electric mini in around three years .
bmw was one of the first movers into electric cars , when it launched its i3 battery-powered city car in 2013 .
since then , however , the market has become crowded with rivals such as daimler , volkswagen and tesla motors .

documents.title: new build homes still covered by help to buy
text: another scaling back of george osborne 's economic plan by the new administration - part of the help to buy scheme for for first-time house buying is to end .
paul smee , director general of the council of mortgage lenders , said the part of the scheme that is ending is mortgage guarantees on houses that already exist - not new build homes .
`` the equity loan scheme for new-build homes will continue , '' he says .
so how important was the scheme to new buyers ?
`` when it was first set up in 2013 it provided access to high loan-to-value mortgages at a time when the market was n't delivering them in the right quantities , '' he adds .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: mayor to investigate london property market - report
text: is foreign investment distorting london 's property market and driving prices higher ?
london 's mayor sadiq khan wants to find out , and is launching an inquiry into the situation , according to the guardian today .

`` it 's clear we need to better understand the different roles that overseas money plays in london 's housing market , the scale of what 's going on , and what action we can take to support development and help londoners find a home , '' mr khan told the guardian .

documents.title: greece 'safe ' from deutsche bank jitters
text: greece is n't worried about deutsche bank .
yannis stournaras , governor of the bank of greece , said the banking systems in greece and internationally were `` safe '' .
he said : `` i am not worried .
we have tools in our hands to protect ourselves from any unfavorable developments . ''

deutsche bank was trading 14.2 % ahead in the us as speculation circulated that it may have negotiated down a $ 14bn fine levied against the lender for mis-selling mortgage-backed bonds during the financial crisis .

documents.title: bp calls deepwater horizon film inaccurate
text: bp is not happy with a new hollywood movie about the fatal deepwater horizon oil rig disaster off the gulf of mexico in 2010 .
the film called - surprise , surprise - deepwater horizon and starring mark wahlberg , is inaccurate according to bp 's geoff morrell .
he said : `` the deepwater horizon movie is hollywood 's take on a tragic and complex accident .
it is not an accurate portrayal of the events that led to the accident , our people , or the character of our company . ''
the explosion cost 11 men their lives and unleashed millions of barrels of oil , leading to a massive clean-up operation .
according to mr morrell , the film `` ignores the conclusions reached by every official investigation : that the accident was the result of multiple errors made by a number of companies . ''

documents.title: oil prices skirt $ 50 a barrel
text: oil prices edged closer to $ 50 a barrel on friday .
earlier this week , the opec cartel of oil producing nations agreed to reduce output for the first time in eight years .

while oil prices swung over concerns over whether the nations that are part of opec could agree on which countries would reduce production and by how much , they eventually sustained an upwards trajectory .
brent crude rose to $ 49.96 a barrel .

documents.title: zimbabwe import ban hurts locals
text: a import ban by the zimbabwe government risks severely harming its citizens and local businesses , but the state is unrepentant .
the bbc 's nomsa maseko reports .

documents.title: uk boardrooms yet to bridge gender gap
text: francesca mcdonagh , head of retail banking and wealth management at hsbc , tells wake up to money that there is still a dearth of women in executive roles .
in more than 20 years in banking , not enough has changed .

documents.title: housebuilders fail to lift ftse 100
text: the ftse 100 ended friday down 14.76 points at 6,904.6 .
housebuilders led the risers , with barratt developments up 4.4 % , persimmon rising 4.1 % and taylor wimpey ahead 2.6 % .
however , capita topped the fallers for a second day after the outsourcing giant issued a profit warning on thursday .
on friday , capita 's shares fell 3.8 % .

documents.title: deutsche bank may have cut $ 14bn fine
text: rumours are circulating that deutsche bank may have negotiated a reduction in a $ 14bn fine by the us for mis-selling mortgage-backed bonds during the financial crisis .
afp is reporting that the bank has agreed with us officials to pay $ 5.4bn instead .
deutsche bank 's shares listed in frankfurt jumped by 5.3 % .
in new york , it traded 12.2 % higher .

documents.title: mr carney goes to washington
text: there will be plenty for delegates to get their teeth into at the international monetary fund ( imf ) and world bank annual meeting in washington next week .
one of the more pertinent events , for britain at least , will be an appearance by mark carney , governor of the bank of england .
so far , predictions of post-brexit catastrophe are yet to materialise .
early friday , new figures showed that britain 's dominant services sector grew by 0.4 % in july , immediately after the vote to leave the eu .
mr carney will take part in a debate about the global economy on thursday 6 october alongside germany 's finance minister wolfgang schauble .

documents.title: business rates change 'largest in a generation'bbc business presenter tweets
text: '000s of firms are about to see `` the largest change in a generation '' to the amount they pay in business rates .
a quick upsum from oxford st
@ twitterid easy solution , move to cities like liverpool , manchester , glasgow etc where costs are lower
lots of small businesses rely on local relationships w suppliers , kids in schools etc .
not easy to up sticks & move
yes obvs not all can esp if they serve local market , but back office/on line firms may be able to
you 've got no right to be looking as good as you are at this time of the day vicky ! !
have a good w/e xx
@ twitterid wish you could be the business presenter all the time victoria you 're good !
you looked great on tv this morning
its the small operators that are going to be hit the most , gunna be some baited breath today x
just what we need with an already struggling streat retail market .
your gorgeous
that is a very impressive ( to me ) piece !
i 'm assuming there was no teleprompter/notes as you were holding your phone ?
true pro !
@ twitterid looking lovely if i may say

documents.title: clear skies for air berlin flyers
text: it really has been a trying week for german business .
deutsche bank 's shares have been battered , commerzbank announced nearly 10,000 job cuts and now air berlin 's boss has had to speak up to reassure people it will keep flying them around .
the company is undergoing a major restructure and earlier this week announced 1,200 jobs will go .
chief executive stefan pichler , said : `` i want to reassure every customer that we continue to operate all our flights as scheduled . ''
boarding passes at the ready then .

documents.title: loco about cocos
text: with any story about banks , it always involves terminology that is mind-bendingly complicated .
for avid followers of deutsche bank 's woes , worry not , there is a solution .
tonight on @ twitterid i shall explain coco bonds .
and you shall watch and enjoy mightily
iplayer
i would n't bank on it !
( see what i did there )
ooh , but that 's good
unlikely because i do n't have a tv .
buy a telly this afternoon
no thanks , i 'd rather stick to radio .
the are better .
do they make the milk turn chocolaty ?
someone had to crack that and it was the potty-mouthed radio golf swear machine
and you knew that someone would be me !
will you be getting 'snap , crackle and pop ' in there somewhere ? !
( obvs 'joke ' i know ! ! )

# ty
i 'm setting the record button now ( and if there any bowls of coco pops i will expect a discount on the licence fee , adam !
can i be the first to make a 'you should coco ' joke ?
nah , i 'll be in the pub

documents.title: ups and downs in paris and sunderland
text: are you absurdly rich ?
then feast your eyes on this little beauty .
this is renault 's new concept car , called the trezor , and it made its appearance at the paris motor show on friday .
renault 's chief executive , carlos ghosn , was on hand to witness the unveiling .
but mr ghosn was less cheery in his other role as the chief executive of nissan .

commenting on what brexit means for nissan 's sunderland plant , which employs nearly 7.000 people , he said : `` if i need to make an investment in the next few months and i ca n't wait until the end of brexit , then i have to make a deal with the uk government .
`` you can have commitments of compensation in case you have something negative .
if there are tax barriers being established on cars , you have to have a commitment for carmakers who export to europe that there is some kind of compensation . ''

documents.title: no state help for deutsche bank
text: just in case deutsche bank was n't getting the message , there will be no government help for the lender .
jeroen dijsselbloem , the president of the eurogroup said on friday that deutsche bank must survive `` on its own '' , without assistance from the german state .
the german government has already made it clear it will not step in to help the bank .
though deutsche bank does n't need rescuing , according to its chief executive john cryan who reassured staff at the bank this morning .

documents.title: deutsche bank rebounds in us trading
text: that email from deutsche bank 's chief executive john cryan seems to have done the trick .
shares in the bank rebounded in early trading in the us and rose by 6.45 % .
reports on thursday that hedge funds had withdrawn cash from the bank , which was already facing questions over its ability to pay a $ 14bn us fine , had sent its shares plunging .
mr cryan reassured employees on friday morning that the bank was healthy .

documents.title: london 'to ban dangerous lorries by 2020 '
text: lorries which do n't let their drivers see the road clearly are to be banned from london from 2020 , mayor sadiq khan has announced .

`` recent data shows that hgvs were involved in 22.5 % of pedestrian fatalities and 58 % of cyclist fatalities on london 's roads in 2014 and 2015 , despite only making 4 % of the miles driven in the capital .
`` the restriction of drivers ' field of direct vision by vehicle design has been proven to have contributed to many of these fatalities , '' said the mayor 's office .

documents.title: deutsche boss blames `` market forces '' for turbulence
text: some more highlights from the email that john cyran , chief executive of deutsche bank , sent out to staff this morning to calm jitters .
he told deutsche bank employees : `` it is our task now to prevent distorted perception from further interrupting our daily business .
trust is the foundation of banking .
`` some forces in the markets are currently trying to damage this trust . ''
he added : `` we have significantly decreased our market and credit risk in recent years .
at no point in the last two decades has the balance sheet of deutsche bank been as stable as it is today . ''
mr cryan also said : `` there is therefore no basis for this speculation .
nor can uncertainty about the outcome of our litigation cases in the us explain this pressure on our stock price , if we take the settlements of our peers as a benchmark . ''
the us stock market opens very shortly so we 'll see how investors there will respond .

documents.title: ireland , brexit and a hard border
text: colm o'regan examines whether brexit will resurrect a hard border between northern and southern ireland and what the economic implications are .

documents.title: deutsche bank : reality v perception
text: the joint chief executive of the berlin stock exchange has quashed speculation that deutsche bank needs to be rescued .
artur fischer said that the market was betting there would be a bailout but insisted there was a `` disconnect between reality and perception '' .
`` reality is what you have in the balance sheet of deutsche .
i tell you they have three times as much capital then the share value is three times as much .
`` so the reality is actually is much much better then the perception , but the perception at the end counts so people act on perception. ``

documents.title: car makers plan for electric future
text: at the paris motor show , it is electric cars that have been making the running .
the bbc ' s theo leggett has been taking a look at some of the car manufacturers ' latest electric concepts .
author: Theo Leggett
BBC Business News Reporter

documents.title: mps to investigate asos working conditions
text: mps are to investigate working conditions at the online fashion retailer asos .
it is after an investigation by buzzfeed news revealed workers at its warehouse nearly barnsley said they were `` treated like machines '' .
some claimed they had to go without regular toilet or water breaks .
the company calls the accounts `` inaccurate '' , `` misleading '' and `` out of date '' .
read more here .

documents.title: what are deutsche bank 's options ?
text: here we go again .
financial markets fretting about the health of eurozone banks .
what is different this time is that the outbreak is centred on the biggest bank in europe 's biggest economy .
it has a few options before it would even think about turning to the government .
read more here .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: 'it 's pretty much of a shock '
text: the bbc 's colletta smith has been investigating the impact of rising business rates in london .
julie runs a gift shop in raynes park in london .
her rates have just gone up by nearly 10 %

documents.title: banks drag on ftse 100
text: the ftse 100 stock index is around 0.97 % lower , with banks and insurers prominent among the losers .
investors have become increasingly nervous since news emerged that the deutsche bank faces a penalty of up to $ 14bn in the united states for mis-selling mortgage-backed securities .
nicholas hyett , an equity analyst at hargreaves lansdown , says :

deutsche bank 's woes are sending ripples through the uk stock market today banks and insurers dominate the fallers , with prudential , whose asset management business m & g has a significant european customer base , among the biggest fallers , down 2.7 % .

`` that uncertainty has set investors fleeing to traditional safe havens that has left gold and silver miners at the top of the ftse 100 , randgold was the biggest riser , up 1.7 % with silver producer fresnillo up 1.4 % to claim second spot . ''

documents.title: ttip : back from the dead ?
text: the european union and the us have been working on a trade deal since 2013 , known as the transatlantic trade and investment partnership or ttip .
the deal seemed to be in jeopardy after negative comments from the french president and a senior german minister .
but it seems the controversial deal is by no means dead in the water :
rumours of ttip death might have been exaggerated : eu trade comm malmstrom : `` negotiations are continuing and they are very intense ''
bad news .
needs to be binned forever .

documents.title: virgin east coast strike to go ahead
text: rail union the rmt has said a strike on virgin trains east coast is to go ahead on monday .
the action is part of an ongoing dispute over job cuts , working conditions and safety .

documents.title: tourists 'spend record amount on english day trips in august '
text: british tourists spent a record £ 5.5bn on day trips in england in august , says visitengland .
people mainly to took trips to go out for a meal .
leisure activities including walking , cycling and golf were also popular , as was visiting friends and family .

documents.title: new disco at the paris motor show
text: the bbc 's theo leggett tweets from the paris motor show :
who 's stolen my doors ? !
new # discovery from # landrover at the # parismotorshow
just google `` b pillar discovery sport '' and you will see why !
jlr at their worst !
however will be swopping our bmws for jags/lrs if eu apply tariffs or play silly buggers @ twitterid
actually a freelander 3 only think that makes it a discovery is the price tag .
@ landrover

documents.title: the unstoppable march of peppa pig
text: children 's tv character peppa pig is likely be at least passingly familiar to anyone with young kids .
the porcine wonder seems to be making the bacon for its owner entertainment one .

demand for peppa pig merchandise in the us has been `` even stronger than expected '' , entertainment one said in a half yearly trading update , while the diminutive piglet is also taking china by storm .

`` in china , the show has now surpassed 6 billion views on local on-demand platforms since launching in october 2015 and it is also one of the most popular programmes for pre-schoolers on state television broadcaster cctv , '' the company said .

documents.title: deutsche bank shares rally
text: deutsche bank shares have recovered a bit from the early slump .
they are now down almost 4 % .
commerzbank is the biggest loser on frankfurt 's main index .
shares are down more than 5 % .overall the dax is down a little more than 1 % .
this is what connor campbell from spreadex has to say about deutsche .
the release of a memo from deutsche bank ceo john cryan to his staff seems to have taken the edge off of the german company 's dramatic decline this friday .

in it cryan insisted that the fears surrounding the bank 's financial health were misplaced , pointing to the €215 billion it holds in liquidity reserves alongside the €1 billion it earned in half year pre-tax profit during the first 6 months of 2016 as examples of its ability to weather the storm it has found itself in .

documents.title: new information commissioner
text: technology correspondent rory cellan-jones tweets :
new information commissioner already proving feisty - on brexit and on whatapp data sharing
why ?
the reason we are leaving is to stop unelected people like her telling us what to do
she 's not an eu regulator , she 's a british regulator and will still be one post brexit
nope we wo n't have any regulators only the eu will no matter what their origin , they do n't speak for their own nations anyway
so we wo n't have ofcom , ofgem , ofwat etc ?
feisty ?
or
ca n't men be feisty ?
i think argument about information commissioners in past was they were n't feisty enough
the point is not about what men are or are not .
nor about information commissioners .
the point is about patronising language .
@ twitterid perhsps the communications management association formerly telecommunications managers association could scrutinize
@ twitterid @ twitterid if the measures make sense then they must be adopted .
point is any regulation scrutinized best practice
it makes one wonder how on earth our sovereign parliament passed any reasonable legislation pre 1973 when eu did n't do it for us

documents.title: hyperloop 'could change human relationships '
text: the hyperloop transport system has promised to blast us between destinations at 600mph .
bibop gresta says that kind of technology could change the way we make friends and find partners .

documents.title: china risk on the rise ?
text: concerns about a slowdown in the chinese economy have not been causing so much market volatility of late - but should markets be taking more notice ?
sean yokota , head of asia strategy at nordic corporate bank seb , says :
china 's biggest risk is debt .
our estimates show china 's debt at about 230 % of gdp .
furthermore , the problem is compounded because this keeps increasing .
with high debt and economy slowing , the central bank has kept policy accommodative to make sure the debt can be easily rolled over and avoid financial instability . ''
he says this `` kick the can down the road '' policy has caused problems including riskier investments , smaller margins for banks , and riskier bank behaviour .

documents.title: banking sector 'under fire from doj '
text: deutsche bank shares are recovering somewhat - they are now more than 4 % down , having dropped 9 % earlier .
joshua mahony , market analyst at ig , says :
`` market sentiment continues to suffer as a result of recent deutsche bank woes , with the financial sector leading the race to the bottom this morning .

`` with the us department of justice aiming to also penalise barclays and credit suisse alongside deutsche , there is a fear that we could see huge amounts of fines levied across the whole industry , effectively wiping out much of the safety buffers built up in case of emergency , '' he says .

documents.title: uk economy may slow in third quarter
text: this from capital economics :
although the incoming economic data has suggested that the immediate economic impact of brexit has not been as severe as some had expected , growth still looks to have slowed markedly in q3 .
indeed , survey measures point to quarterly growth of only a bit above zero .

nonetheless , with another cut in interest rates likely when the mpc meets again on 3rd november , and some easing in the fiscal squeeze set to be announced later that month in the autumn statement , we do n't think that the economy is headed into a more pronounced downturn .

documents.title: ofgem launches probe into big six challenger 'e '
text: energy market regulator ofgem has launched a probe into big six energy firm challenger e .
ofgem is investigating e 's marketing and sales activities .

`` the investigation will examine whether e breached licence conditions which require suppliers to provide information which is complete and accurate and is easily understood by customers when undertaking marketing and sales activities , '' ofgem said .

documents.title: virgin media : 'business rates a proxy infrastructure tax '
text: following bt 's statement that changes to rates might mean higher bills for consumers and businesses , virgin media has said the rate rise is akin to an infrastructure tax .

virgin media chief executive tom mockridge said : `` the chancellor philip hammond is choosing to side-step responsibility for a huge increase in infrastructure taxes at the very moment after the brexit vote the uk needs to maximise investment into its digital fibre network . ''
the firm expects its rateable value to quadruple .

documents.title: pound given lift by economic data
text: the pound was given a bit of a prod by the latest economic data .
it traded as high as $ 1.2989 , up about half a cent from the lows of the session .
the chart below shows how the pound has faired against the dollar this year .
you can see the sharp fall after the june referendum result .
the pound had been close to $ 1.50 , but since then has been trading around $ 1.30 .

documents.title: uk current account deficit rises
text: the uk 's current account deficit - how much the value of imports of goods , services and investment income exceeds exports - rose to £ 28.7bn in the second quarter up from a revised deficit of £ 27bn in the first quarter , the ons says .
the trade deficit widened to £ 12.7bn from £ 10bn .

documents.title: breakinguk second quarter growth revised upwards
text: the uk economy grew 0.7 % in the second quarter , according to the office for national statistics .
that 's revised up from its previous estimate of 0.6 % .
in july the service sector grew by 0.4 % , which was stronger than economists had been expecting .

`` together this fresh data tends to support the view that there has been no sign of an immediate shock to the economy , although the full will continue to emerge , '' ons statistician darren morgan said .

documents.title: deutsche bank boss emails staff
text: deutsche bank chief executive john cryan has emailed staff .
he 's told them the bank has become the object of `` hefty speculation '' and that `` new rumours '' are causing the share price to fall .
but he says that the bank 's finances are strong .
at no point in the last 20 years has deutsche bank been as strong as it is now , he said .
he says the legal situation in the us is no ground for pressure on the share price .

documents.title: breakingbt says higher rates could push up bills
text: bt has said new , higher business rates could lead to rising prices for consumers and businesses .
we are extremely disappointed by the new rateable values that have been published today and which are clearly excessive , '' the firm said in a statement .
`` stability is important for any business , so imposing a rateable value that is four times the current level is both unwelcome and unacceptable .
it is .
highly likely that an increase of this size would lead to higher prices for consumers and businesses given our business rates feed into our regulated wholesale prices . ''
new rateable values for bt are £ 715m in england and £ 28m in wales , compared to the current rateable values of £ 158m and £ 7m respectively .

documents.title: falling sales at trinity mirror
text: trinity mirror shares have fallen almost 2 % .
the company has forecast that group revenue will fall 9 % in the third quarter ( the 13 weeks to 2 october ) , compared to the same quarter last year .
advertising sales in its publications fell by 21 % and sales from selling newspapers was down by 6 % .
digital revenue was up 11 % .

documents.title: who will take over at john lewis ?
text: as expected , last night john lewis boss andy street was selected as conservative candidate for west midlands mayor .
retail analyst nick bubb runs through some of the possible replacements .

`` andy 's former no 2 , andrew murphy , who was promoted to be the group productivity director last september , was the favourite , but , at john lewis , the commercial director paula nickolds and the retail director mark lewis will fancy their chances , whilst on the board the former waitrose fd , tom athron , now the group development director , will also be in the mix , '' he says .

documents.title: natwest 'to become main rbs brand in england '
text: rbs group has announced that it will relaunch its brands .
natwest will become its main brand for customers in england , wales and western europe .
in scotland , royal bank of scotland will be the primary name .

documents.title: deutsche bank shares slide
text: deutsche bank shares have fallen almost 9 % in early trading in frankfurt , falling to a new record low below €10 .
traders there are catching up with falls made overnight in new york .
investors were rattled by a report that some hedge funds have been withdrawing funds from the bank .
commerzbank shares have tumbled 5 % .
that 's weighing on frankfurt 's dax index , which is down 1.5 % .

documents.title: banking stocks hit ftse 100
text: banking shares are being hammered in london after deutsche bank share were hit overnight ( see previous posts ) .
lloyds banking group is down 3.6 % , royal bank of scotland is down 3.5 % , barclays is down 2.9 % .
that 's weighing on the ftse 100 which is down 1.2 % .

documents.title: h & m profits slide
text: profits at fashion retailer hennes & mauritz fell in its third quarter , which ran from june to the end of august .
the swedish retailer reported a net profit of 6.3bn swedish krona ( £ 570m ) , down 10 % on the same quarter last year .
h & m said there has been a `` challenging '' start to the autumn season , caused by hot weather in late august and september .
a strong dollar has hit profits by raising the company 's costs .

documents.title: d-day for business rates
text: it 's d-day for business rates today - businesses will find out at 9:30 what their new rateable values are .

some prime london retailers are set for increases of up to 100 % - but there could be some big winners outside the south east , as property values have fallen sharply since 2012 , when the last values were done .
author: Dominic O'Connell
Business Presenter, BBC Radio 4 Today programme

documents.title: commercial property market in north east 'decimated '
text: andy preston invests in commercial property in the north east of england .
he explained to radio 5 live what has happened in that market since 2008 .
`` the commercial property market - office building , shops , things like that - has been decimated .
there are still huge office blocks that they just ca n't get tenants for .
and the main reason they ca n't get tenants for them , is that the rates are just way too high . ''
`` it 's really holding the north east back . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: deutsche bank 'one of the big links in the chain '
text: the financial world is getting jittery about deutsche bank .
its shares took another dive yesterday after reports that some big customers were beginning to withdraw their cash .
but why should we be worried about a german bank ?

bbc business editor simon jack says `` we learned from 2008 that it 's pretty connected world , and if a big bank has problems , like lehman brothers back in 2008 , the rest of the world has a big problem too . ''

he says on paper the bank is rock solid , but not everyone agrees - the imf thinks that deutsche bank is potentially the biggest threat to global banking stability - `` it 's one of the big links in the chain that links the whole world together '' , simon says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: housing market cools
text: the rate of house price growth slowed in september , according to the latest figures from nationwide .
its annual rate of house price growth slowed to 5.3 % in september , from 5.6 % in august .

`` survey data indicates that , while new buyer enquiries have remained fairly subdued , the number of homes on the market has remained close to all-time lows , in part due to low rates of construction activity , '' said robert gardner , nationwide 's chief economist .

documents.title: fat finger snafu revealed rate changes
text: although the new business rates are due to be out today , on tuesday somebody pressed the wrong button in the valuation office , and for 45 minutes we were given a sneak preview of rates changes , says john webber of colliers international .

`` actually for people on the likes of bond street and oxford street and marylebone high street , it did n't make pleasant viewing , because the increases , certainly in marylebone high street , as an example , are in excess of 100 % . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: business rates revamped
text: businesses are holding their breath because this morning they 'll find out what their new business rate bills are going to be .
john webber of property consultants colliers international told the today programme :

`` the main issue in recent times is the fact that in 2012 to government in their wisdom decided to postpone the 2015 rating revaluation [ to 2017 ] the problem was that it came at a time when the current list had a valuation date of 2008 , and the valuation date for the list that 's going to be revealed today is 2015 , so that seven year gap actually covered a period when there were some enormous changes [ in property values ] . ''
in that seven years , small businesses had to pay high rates , even though their property values had plunged .

`` there are places throughout the midlands and north where there will be reductions of 30 % , 40 % , 50 % , 60 % in rateable values , and quite honestly those values should have been realigned two years ago , '' mr webber adds .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: asia stocks head lower
text: financial shares in asia have been rattled by concerns over deutsche bank .
in china , hong kong 's hang seng fell 1.3 % .
but shares on the chinese mainland held firm .
shares in tokyo were undermined by a stronger yen .
the nikkei 225 fell by 1.4 % .
in australia , the asx 200 was lower by 0.5 % while the kospi in south korea lost 1 % .

documents.title: will london get an nfl team ?
text: is london likely to get an american football team to compete in the nfl ?
`` there 's still a way to go , '' says mark waller , the executive vice-president for international at the nfl , on wake up to money .
decisions are made by the 32 owners of the existing clubs and it 's very difficult to predict how they will act , he says .
los angeles did not have a team for 20 years and nothing was done for 17 years , he points out .
but when the owners did decide to give los angeles a team , things moved quite quickly .
last year the new york jets beat the miami dolphins at wembley stadium .
this weekend the indianapolis colts take on the jacksonville jaguars .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: samsung to start selling galaxy note 7 again
text: samsung electronics is going to put its galaxy note 7 smartphone back on sale in south korea this weekend .
earlier this month it suspended sales of the phone and recalled those already sold due to faulty batteries that could catch fire while charging .
around 2.5 million phones have been sold worldwide .
samsung says that 60 % of owners in the us had already swapped their phones for new ones .
the bbc 's rico hizon says the firm is throwing in a `` sweetener '' for those who buy a new phone in october .
the firm is offering 50 % off any repairs needed to the phone , including screen replacements .
the phone is due to go back on sale in the us on 21 october and in europe from 28 october .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: european shares expected to open lower
text: david buik from panmure gordon tweets :
deutsche bank share price fell 6.67 % in new york last night ?
messrs merkel , schauble and weidmann - well ! ! ?
it 's not actually going to go bust though david ?
oh for heavens sake listen to yourself david - you sound like a junkie gagging for another fix to get high !
david , it would be too embarrassing for merkel & co to step in they 'll likely let other german domestic banks prop them up ?
european opening offers scant comfort !
merkel , schauble and weidmann - where are you ?
ftse -58 , dax -122 , cac -56 courtesy of ig at 5.20am
pressure is rising on germany to show it 's ready to rescue deutsche bank
the us and their $ 14bn threat is the issue yet they get upset when apple is told to pay the tax bill # irony

documents.title: business rates - how retailers will be hit
text: businesses today find out how they will be affected by the review of business rates .

property consultants colliers international estimates that 300 retail centres across britain will see a decrease in business rates , 21 are likely to pay the same and 76 , mostly in london and the south east , will see a rise in business rates .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: deutsche bank : 'investors getting twitchy '
text: shares in deutsche bank sank almost 7 % in trading in new york , after a report said that ten hedge funds had withdrawn some funds due to concerns about the bank 's condition .
`` investors are definitely getting twitchy people are concerned about how deutsche bank are going to refinance themselves .

if they ca n't refinance themselves , where are they going to get the money from - especially as the german government has said that it 's not prepared to fund it itself , '' chris ralph , chief investment officer at st jame 's place , told wake up to money .
deutsche bank has a number of options before it would need government help , points out mr ralph .
it could sell assets , it could sell shares on the stock market and it could go to other german lenders to seek assistance .
author: BBC Radio 5 live
